textBeforeTable: Flat view Next unread Next Previous First Parent Forum Complain Reply   Reply with quote   JimC ------ Or, if you prefer a clean install, contact Dell and argue that you need a Windows 8 install disk and license key to use for that purpose.   Or, install Windows 7 instead if you have a valid copy with a license key. So, I'd probably try the $20 Paragon software to see if that works for you.   Chances are, the system is already using AHCI with compatible drivers installed, so you wouldn't need to change that part.  Just disable Secure Boot in -- hide signature --
